H2.text: Orange juice is not a mixture.

H3.text: Salt is not a mixture, as the question asks which of the following is NOT a mixture.

A4.text: Air is one such example: it can be more specifically described as a gaseous solution of oxygen and other gases dissolved in nitrogen (its major component).

A5.text: In chemistry, a salt or ionic compound is a chemical compound consisting of an assembly of positively charged ions (cations) and negatively charged ions (anions), which results in a compound with no net electric charge.

A6.text: Salts do not exist in solution.
